Package com.blukii.sdk.info

blukii library package for communication with blukii Manager Info CMS.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BlukiiInfo.OnGetInfoBundlesListener
    Listener for callbacks of function BlukiiInfo.getInfoBundles(List, OnGetInfoBundlesListener).
    BlukiiInfo.OnGetInfoDataListener
    Listener for callbacks of function BlukiiInfo.getInfoData(List, OnGetInfoDataListener).
    BlukiiInfo.OnReportListener
    Listener for callbacks of function BlukiiInfo.reportClick(String, long, OnReportListener) and BlukiiInfo.reportInfoViolation(InfoData, String, String, String, String, OnReportListener).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlukiiInfo
    Main controller class of package info, for interacting with blukii Manager Info CMS (see manager.blukii.com) BlukiiClient class contains discovery functions as follows: Request for getting blukii Info output data.
    InfoBundleData
    Read only data object for Info Bundle data retrieved from blukii Manager Info CMS.
    InfoBundleOutputData
    Read only data object for output language based info bundle data retrieved from blukii Manager Info CMS.
    InfoData
    Read only data object for blukii output data retrieved from blukii Manager Info CMS.
    InfoOutputData
    Read only data object for output language based blukii data retrieved from blukii Manager Info CMS.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    OutputType
    Definition of available output types that can be chosen for a blukii number on blukii Manager Info CMS (https://manager.blukii.com).

Package com.blukii.sdk.info Description

blukii library package for communication with blukii Manager Info CMS.

This documentation describes the info package for retrieving and reporting blukii Info data.

The info package supports you by doing the following actions:
  • Retrieving of blukii Info (request by blukii number)
  • Reporting of Info clicks
  • Reporting of Info violations


Getting started:

The controller for all actions is class BlukiiInfo. You only have to create an instance of this class to get all the functionality.

Follow the instructions of the BlukiiInfo documentation page where you can find some code samples about the usage.
